vague_description: Mark needs to decide the optimal distribution of potatoes and cucumbers on his farmland to maximize profit while adhering to specific acreage constraints and contractual obligations.
detailed_description: Mark has \var{TotalAcres} acres of land available to grow potatoes and cucumbers that he sells at a farmers' market. He must grow at least \var{MinPotatoes} acres of potatoes and \var{MinCucumbers} acres of cucumbers to meet his contract. Mark prefers to grow more cucumbers than potatoes, but he only has enough resources to grow at most twice the amount of cucumbers as potatoes, which is \var{MaxRatioCucPot} times the acres of potatoes. If the profit per acre of potatoes is \$\var{ProfitPotatoes} and the profit per acre of cucumbers is \$\var{ProfitCucumbers}, how many acres of each should he grow to maximize his profit? What is that profit?
target_objective: Maximize Mark's profits from growing potatoes and cucumbers
target_constraints: Number of acres of potatoes is non-negative
Number of acres of cucumbers is non-negative
Number of acres used for both potatoes and cucumbers does not exceed TotalAcres
At least MinPotatoes acres of potatoes are grown
At least MinCucumbers acres of cucumbers are grown
Number of acres of cucumbers is at most MaxRatioCucPot times the number of acres of potatoes
target_parameters: Total acres of land available for potatoes and cucumbers
Minimum acres required to grow potatoes
Minimum acres required to grow cucumbers
Maximum ratio of cucumbers to potatoes
